This is a manufacturing process we developed in the off season.

posts.name: Brian Wagg
posts.cooked:
Some form of injection molding?

I’m just as perplexed and curious as you are, lol.

posts.name: Andrew Schreiber
posts.cooked: Looks like vacuum infusion of chopped CF fiber?

posts.name: Gdeaver
posts.cooked: Bingo! I’ll comment more tomorrow about why this kind of new.

posts.name: Andrew Schreiber
posts.cooked:
Ok, well then I’ll keep guessing:

You’ve done chopped carbon fiber swerve forks using a printed mold. Big benefit over printed is that you have a more isotropic material than with traditional 3d printing.

If I’m right, I’m actually shocked you went vacuum infusion vs a “forged” approach with a pair of molds. I guess vacuum gives you a more optimal epoxy percentage?

If I’m barking up the right tree - can’t wait to hear details, I’ve been considering trying this approach for my own edification.

posts.name: Gdeaver
posts.cooked:
Here is a picture of our 2023 swerve modules finished with the vacuum infused chopped carbon fiber  and hollow resin printed mold. Busy day will write up more later. image 1200×800 92 KB

image 1200×800 92 KB

image 1200×800 92 KB

posts.name: Ryan Dognaux
posts.cooked: Always appreciate the yearly 1640 swerve thread. Y’all are still trying new things which is awesome. I remember being pit neighbors on 1720 with you in 2019 at worlds and the bench top module demo was amazing to watch. Keep up the great work!
